business.headline: Who has to file ITR by when? All 2025 deadlines explainedFiling your ITR on time can save you from paying extra penalties. But not everyone has the same deadline this year. Here's a quick look at who must file by when for the 2025 cycle.

Sensex tumbles over 600 points: Why stock markets are in the red today The benchmark S&P BSE Sensex fell 624.64 points to 81,559.53 by 10:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 215.85 points to 24,846.25.

Explained: Why IEX share price gained 11% todayIEX stock opened at Rs 137.00 today, higher than the previous close of Rs 132.45. It climbed further to touch a high of Rs 149.45 in morning trade. As of 9:37 am, the share was trading at Rs 146.80, up 10.84%.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finance shares tumbled 6% despite strong Q1 resultsThe Bajaj Finance stock was down 5.42% at Rs 907 on the BSE at around 9:28 am, while Bajaj Finserv also fell nearly 5%. Bajaj Finance touched an intraday low of Rs 898.10, marking a 6.3% decline.

NSDL IPO: Check price band, GMP, key dates, issue size and moreThe IPO, a pure offer for sale, aims to raise Rs 4,011 crore. It will open for subscription on July 30 and close on August 1, with anchor bids starting a day earlier on July 29.

Sensex falls 300 points at opening, Nifty below 25,000; Bajaj Finance tanks 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.42 points to 81,794.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.70 points to 24,928.40 as of 9:25 am.

IEX stock: Indian Energy Exchange shares to be in focus today. Here's whyIEX shares fell sharply on Thursday, July 24. The stock dropped as much as 28% and touched a 52-week low of Rs 135.26 on the BSE.
Intel layoffs: 25,000 roles at risk as company braces for big reset, says reportIn a letter to employees, Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan acknowledged the difficult period the company is going through.

Why Donald Trump doesn't want Google, Microsoft to hire IndiansSpeaking at an AI Summit in Washington on Wednesday, Donald Trump said American companies must now put national interest first, especially in the fast-growing field of artificial intelligence.

Kristin Cabot, Astronomer HR head, resigns after viral Coldplay kiss-cam scandalAstronomer's HR chief Kristin Cabot resigned days after being caught on a Coldplay kiss-cam with CEO Andy Byron, who also stepped down earlier amid the viral scandal and public backlash.

Billionaire behind your browser: Sundar Pichai's net worth crosses $1 billionAlphabet stock has returned around 120% to investors since 2023 and is now trading close to its all-time high. This has benefited top executives, including Sundar Pichai.

India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

entertainment.headline: Fantastic Four First Steps X review: Fans praise MCU's strongest masterpiece yetMarvel's 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' released in theatres today with mixed reviews. Fans praised the stellar performances of the actors Vanessa Kirby and Pedro Pascal, who stand out in the film.

Travis Kelce makes his romance with Taylor Instagram and lock screen officialTravis Kelce posted some adorable couple photos with Taylor Swift on Instagram, revealing that his phone lock screen is a black-and-white picture of the two of them together.

Ananya Panday launches kindness curriculum to teach children empathy through artActor Ananya Panday is taking her mission of spreading kindness to the next level with the launch of a Kindness Curriculum under her So Positive platform, in collaboration with NGO Slam Out Loud.

Chaos breaks out at Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu UK screening, video viralFans of the film 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' caused a disruption at a UK theatre by throwing confetti during the screening, leading to widespread criticism and the screening being halted. The film, starring Pawan Kalyan, has received mixed reviews in India for its ambitious storyline but flawed execution.

Johny Lever's daughter Jamie recalls being asked to strip in scam auditionJamie Lever, actor-comedian and daughter of Johny Lever, recently recalled a disturbing audition experience where she was asked to strip. She shared that while she had been informed the role was 'bold', the audition quickly took an uncomfortable and inappropriate turn.

War 2 trailer: It's Hrithik Roshan vs Jr NTR in a never-seen-before action sagaThe much-anticipated trailer for 'War 2', starring the never-seen-before actor-duo Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR is out. The film, a sequel to the 2019 film 'War', is scheduled for an Independence Day release.

Fantastic Four First Steps review: Marvel's first family gets a well-deserved reboot Release Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Marvel's 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' refreshes the classic superhero team with a nostalgic yet modern twist, set in a vibrant 1960s retro-futuristic universe. The film shines through its heartfelt character moments and stylish visuals, making it a promising new beginning for the franchise despite some familiar villain shortcomings.

Fahadh Faasil wants to drive an Uber in Barcelona after his retirementMalayalam actor Fahadh Faasil has shared his heartfelt retirement dream of driving an Uber in Barcelona, highlighting his love for simple joys beyond cinema. The actor is currently promoting his latesy film 'Mareesan'.

Su From So review: A superb natural comedy that doubles up as social dramaRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Su From So movie review: Directed by JP Thuminad, this Kannada comedy is a fun ride filled with laughter throughout. The film weaves social drama with comedy and presents a beautiful story.

Tara Sutaria finds cheerleader in Veer Pahariya at fashion show. Watch VideoActor Tara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya's chemistry at a recent fashion show added fuel to dating rumours. Their subtle gestures caught the fans' attention. They also clicked while leaving the event together as well.

Rangeen review: Bold gigolo drama loses impact in executionRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Rangeen series review: 'Rangeen' is a bold series about a man turning gigolo for revenge. The show, featuring Viineet Kumar Siingh and Rajshri Deshpande, struggles with tone and underdeveloped characters despite boasting an intriguing premise.

Mahavatar Narsimha review: Emotionally uplifting tale about devotion, compassionRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025'Mahavatar Narsimha' movie review: 'Mahavatar Narsimha' narrates the story of a young child named Prahlad's devotion to Lord Vishnu. The film makes a powerful statement about faith, compassion, hatred and devotion. Is the animation movie worth your time? Here is our review.

Who is Heisenberg, Tamil cinema's anonymous lyricist? Here's an interesting clueTamil cinema boasts a lyricist named Heisenberg, who is known only by his name. Director Lokesh Kanagaraj, who has worked with him, gave a clue without blowing his cover.

Sarzameen review: A film that forgets Sar, loses Zameen, still thinks it's patrioticRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Sarzameen movie review: In this Ibrahim Ali Khan, Kajol and Prithviraj Sukumaran-starrer, neither the patriotism lands nor the emotional family drama connects. What you get instead is a hollow story trying hard to feel important.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendNetflix's new weekend lineup caters to a diverse audience base. From intense crime-dramas to spine-chilling horror as well as fantasy and comedy genres, there is a mix of various themes in this weekend's releases which appeals to all viewers.
Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendFrom thrillers to crime dramas and reality series, here's what you can watch on JioHotstar this weekend.

Blackpink's Lisa debuts on Netflix's Hitmakers, rejects rough tracksAfter much excitement, Lisa makes her Netflix debut on 'Hitmakers'. Twelve producers present original songs to her, but only one track wins her approval.

Shaan Grover on 'Mahesh Dalle' memes after Saiyaara: Was initially disturbedActor Shaan Grover, in an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, spoke about the criticism he received for his role in 'Saiyaara'. The film stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda in the lead.

Singer Babla Mehta, known as Voice of Mukesh, dies in MumbaiSinger Babla Mehta, known as the Voice of Mukesh, died on July 22 in Mumbai. He also sang alongside legendary singer Late Lata Mangeskar in the film 'Chandni'.

general news.headline: Avoid travel to 7 provinces: India issues advisory on Thailand amid clash with CambodiaAvoid travel to 7 provinces: India issues advisory on Thailand amid clash with Cambodia

Ullu, ALTT, Desiflix, other OTT platforms banned for showing soft porn contentThe government has cracked down on multiple streaming platforms like Ullu, ALTT and Desiflix for hosting soft porn, blocking apps, websites and social media handles.

6 students dead, over 15 injured as school roof collapses in Rajasthan's JhalawarThe roof of a primary school collapsed in Rajasthan's Jhalawar on Friday morning, leaving four students dead and at least 17 injured. Several others are feared trapped under the debris.

Dharmasthala mass-burial case: 5 big questions that raise a stinkA probe by an SIT has been ordered by the Karnataka government into allegations that mass burials of raped and murdered women were carried out over the years in Dharmasthala, a popular temple town. Despite the claims by a whistleblower, there are several unanswered questions that make the case curious.

From one chaiwala to another: Indian tea seller's viral moment with PM in UKThe incident happened when PM Modi and his British counterpart Keir Starmer marked the signing of the landmark free trade agreement (FTA) by sharing a cup of tea.

Why Congress should serve Dhankhar some dhoklaWill Jagdeep Dhankhar return in a non-BJP avatar? It shouldn't be difficult for a protégé of Chaudhary Charan Singh, known for his flexibility, but will Opposition parties, especially the Congress, make the most of a disgruntled BJP leader? The Opposition would do well to serve Dhankhar some dhokla.

Just not cricket: Should Stokes and Archer have attacked Pant's broken toe?ENG vs IND, 4th Test: Rishabh Pant sustained a toe injury on Day 1 at Old Trafford, but the left-handed batter returned to score a gutsy half-century on the second day, helping India put up a score of 358 on the board.

How the mammoth Bihar voter roll revision is unfolding on the groundThe exercise has been a mixed bag: over 90 per cent voters tracked, 1.86 million reported deceased, 2.6 million shifted, 750,000 on multiple lists and 11,000 untraceable

Menopause before 30 is rising: What it means for fertility and how IVF helpsWhat exactly is early menopause? Why is it happening to younger Indian women? And why are so few people talking about it? Doctors answer on World IVF Day.

Kamal Haasan makes Parliament debut, takes oath in Tamil as Rajya Sabha MPActor and MNM chief Kamal Haasan took oath in Tamil as a Rajya Sabha MP on Friday. Backed by DMK, he was elected unopposed after opting for a Parliament seat over the Lok Sabha polls.

'Talibani era' in Bangladesh? Dress code for women, protest gag order spark rowEarlier this week, the Bangladesh Bank caused a storm after it barred women employees from wearing short dresses and clothing with short sleeves. After a backlash, it withdrew the order.
Will the whole world go dark on August 2?Some posts even claim a once-in-a-century event will unfold in 2025, sending schools and skywatchers into a frenzy of false anticipation.

Rape-murder convict caught hours after escaping Kerala jail, was serving life termGovindachamy, convicted in the 2011 Soumya rape and murder case, escaped from Kannur Central Jail but was caught hours later. CCTV footage surfaced. Jail DGP confirmed his arrest and promised action.

How India's strategic assets lie exposed, vulnerable to harmWith detailed imagery of military bases, nuclear plants, border posts and more easily accessible to Open Source Intelligence, how dangerous is this for national security?

PM lands in Maldives, shares warm hug with Muizzu amid focus on diplomatic resetPrime Minister Narendra Modi reached Male to attend the Maldives' 60th Independence Day as Guest of Honour, becoming the first foreign head of state to visit under President Mohamed Muizzu's tenure.

Student beaten in Mumbai over distributing wedding invitation card in MarathiA college student in Navi Mumbai was allegedly beaten for distributing a wedding invite in Marathi. The incident sparked political outrage, with the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena demanding strict action.

sports.headline: Need that Virat Kohli mentality: Gill urged to lead India's series comebackENG vs IND: Michael Vaughan feels that Shubman Gill and Co need to channel in that Virat Kohli mentality to lead a fightback on Day 3 of the Manchester Test.

While the visitors struggled with their batting balance, Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer's standout performances helped keep England in the game with a disciplined effort.

Shubman Gill's tactics slammed by Ponting: Bumrah bowled from wrong endRicky Ponting was heavily critical of Shubman Gill's captaincy on Day 2 of the Manchester Test. The former Australian skipper reckons that Gill has gotten it wrong tactically giving England a quick start in the first innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
